subsection.name: Artifact
subsection.p: An Artifact is a versioned resource that is available for use from one or more Resource Hosts .

subsection.name: Artifact Protocol
subsection.p: A Transit defined protocol that expresses the content, without the location, and letting Transit resolve the location according to its setup. The Artifact Protocol has the format of;

where;
type = The type of the artifact, such as jar, png, dtd. group = The group that the artifact belongs to. Groups are stacked with slashes, such as dpml/transit/main. name = The name of the artifact, such as magic-core. version = The version of the artifact. ref = A reference within the artifact itself. Used to locate resources within jar/zip artifacts.

subsection.name: Link Protocol
subsection.p: The Link Protocol is a URL protocol to link application names to artifact resources. Links points to another URI, typically an Artifact, and getting the InputStream of the Link will return the InputStream of the target URI's InputStream (if resolvable).

subsection.name: Resource Host
subsection.p: A Resource Host is a networked computer that is serving Artifacts to Transit applications.
